intro: Dyschoriste schiedeana var. cinerascens, commonly known as the ash-gray dyschoriste, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes coffee and gardenias, and is characterized by its slender, climbing stems. The plant produces small, white to pale yellow flowers that are typically clustered in cymes. Its leaves are opposite, elliptic to ovate, and have a distinctive ash-gray underside, giving it its common name. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories.
